alert.note: Alert for Mono (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 25 at 4:19PM PST until February 26 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Reno
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM PST SUNDAY... ...BLIZZARD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM MONDAY TO 4 AM PST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning, heavy snow. An additional 2 to 6 inches possible through Sunday morning. For the Blizzard Warning, blizzard conditions expected. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 2 feet, except 8 to 16 inches east of US-395. 3 to 4 feet are possible for areas above 8000 feet. Winds gusting as high as 60 mph. * WHERE...Mono County. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, until 10 AM PST Sunday. For the Blizzard Warning, from 1 PM Monday to 4 AM PST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be near impossible with near zero visibility at times Monday through early Wednesday morning. Strong winds could cause tree damage and power outages. If you risk travel you could become stranded in vehicles for many hours.
info.instruction: Avoid travel if possible, you could be stuck in your vehicle for many hours. If you must travel, prepare for long delays and carry an emergency kit with extra food, water and clothing. If you stay home, have a backup plan in case of power outages. This is a life threatening situation. Do not attempt to travel during blizzard conditions! Road crews and first responders may not be able to rescue you. Stay indoors until the snow and wind subside. Even a short walk could be deadly if you become disoriented. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
